description: The coverage analysis <https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/nova-coverage/cobertura> for nova.vnc currently only reports coverage for the nova/vnc/__init__.py file. However, there are several other files in that directory (auth.py, proxy.py, server.py).
title: nova.vnc coverage analysis missing files

comments.content: The coverage analysis <https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/nova-coverage/cobertura> for nova.vnc currently only reports coverage for the nova/vnc/__init__.py file. However, there are several other files in that directory (auth.py, proxy.py, server.py).
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~lorinh

comments.content: I don't think this is actually a jenkins issue as much as it's an issue in the coverage run, which is driven from run_test.sh in tree. So I'm adding nova to the bug, but I think bug on the jenkins side should stay around until the symptom is solved.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mordred

comments.content: So the vnc code has been rewritten recently, but the bug still does apply to nova/vnc/xvp_proxy.py. Does our coverage tool not report coverage on modules that are never imported?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~bcwaldon
